text: "Start Me Up" is a 1992 single released by American R&B; and hip-hop group Salt-N-Pepa. The song is included in the 1992 American film, Stay Tuned. It was later included on Salt-N-Pepa's 1999 album, The Best of Salt-N-Pepa. The song samples the 1973 song, “Impeach the President” by The Honey Drippers. ==Track listing== ; CD Maxi # Start Me Up (Radio Edit) \- 3:39 # Start Me Up (Alternative Edit) \- 3:58 # Start Me Up (Original Version) \- 3:48 # Start Me Up (Club Version) \- 5:44 # Start Me Up (DJ's Choice) \- 4:28 ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (1992) !Peak position |- |- |- |- |- |UK Singles (Official Charts Company) | style="text- align:center;"|39 |- |UK Music Week Dance Singles | style="text- align:center;"|24 |- |US Billboard Hot Rap Tracks | style="text- align:center;"|84 |} ==References== Category:1992 singles Category:Salt-N-Pepa songs Category:1992 songs Category:London Records singles Category:Songs written by Hurby Azor
